text: Noel Brian Bedford (born 24 December 1933) is a Welsh former professional footballer. He played the majority of his career at Queens Park Rangers, as a centre forward. ==Playing career== He started his professional career at Reading, where he was spotted by Ted Bates who signed him for Southampton in July 1955. He made only a handful of appearances for Southampton before moving on to Bournemouth in August 1956. After scoring 32 goals in 75 games for Bournemouth he was signed by Queens Park Rangers' manager Alec Stock in 1959 for just £750 and made his debut that August in a 2–0 win against Swindon Town. He went on to play 258 league games for Rangers scoring a remarkable 161 goals (180 in all competitions). He is QPR's second highest goal scorer behind George Goddard. However, despite being a prolific striker. his team never managed to achieve promotion to the Second Division. The closest they managed was a third-place finish in 1960–61 with Bedford scoring an impressive 33 in 44 league games that season. Bedford was transferred to Scunthorpe United in August 1965 just as a young and dynamic Queens Park Rangers team was taking shape (they cruised to the Third Division title and win the League Cup just two seasons later). After short spells at Brentford and Scunthorpe United he played briefly in the USA with Atlanta Chiefs. On returning from the U.S. in 1967 however the Football Association banned him from playing as the U.S. Football Association was at the time not affiliated. After a year he successfully appealed the ban and joined Bexley United but a knee injury forced him to retire. Throughout his career he maintained a high strike rate, scoring 229 goals in 399 league appearances. ==Later career== After his retirement from playing he became a professional tennis coach and he was later the stadium manager at Loftus Road, before retiring to Llandaff in 1995. ==References== ==Sources== * * ==External links== * Atlanta Chiefs: Brian Bedford Category:1933 births Category:Living people Category:People from Ferndale Category:Welsh footballers Category:AFC Bournemouth players Category:Brentford F.C. players Category:Queens Park Rangers F.C. players Category:Reading F.C. players Category:Southampton F.C. players Category:Scunthorpe United F.C. players Category:National Professional Soccer League (1967) players Category:Atlanta Chiefs players Category:Bexley United F.C. players Category:Queens Park Rangers F.C. non-playing staff Category:Association football forwards Category:Welsh expatriate sportspeople in the United States Category:Expatriate soccer players in the United States Category:Welsh expatriate footballers
